text: Nordstromia vira is a moth in the family Drepanidae. It was described by Moore in 1866. Note: This source gives 1865 as the year of description. It is found in Myanmar, India (Sikkim, Darjeeling, Assam), Nepal and China (Sichuan, Fujian, Tibet). The wingspan is about 27 mm.Novitates Zoologicae 4: 12 Adults are pale fawn colour, the hindwings pale yellow anteriorly. There are two oblique dark brown lines crossing both wings, between which are three small whate discal spots. There is a pale submarginal line and the exterior border of both wings is defined by a brown line.Proceedings of the Zoological Society of London 1865 (3): 817 ==References== Category:Moths described in 1866 Category:Drepaninae
title: Nordstromia vira
